intro: Sesamoides clusii, commonly known as the Clusius's sesamoid, is a rare and lesser-known plant species belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its hairy, herbaceous stems and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its leaves are ovate with serrated edges, and it produces capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Sesamoides clusii is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
